summary: This document is a letter from Rob, Psy.D., the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator for the Federal Bureau of Prisons, to a warden. It details the scheduling and logistical preparations for a 'Psychological Reconstruction' of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, including staff interviews, required documents, and travel arrangements for the visiting team.

persons.name: Rob
persons.role: National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Author of the letter, coordinating the scheduling and logistics for the Psychological Reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Thank
persons.context: Will be joining Rob for the Psychological Reconstruction of inmate Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of the scheduled Psychological Reconstruction.

connections.description: Rob, as the National Suicide Prevention Coordinator, is organizing a psychological assessment/reconstruction for inmate Epstein.
Thank, as a Correctional Services Administrator, will be part of the team conducting the psychological assessment of inmate Epstein.
Colleagues within the Federal Bureau of Prisons working together on the psychological reconstruction of an inmate.

events.title: Scheduling of Psychological Reconstruction for Epstein
events.description: A Psychological Reconstruction is scheduled to be conducted for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, involving staff interviews and document review.

locations: Federal Bureau of Prisons Psychology Services Branch, 320 First Street, NW Washington DC, DC 20534
keyFacts: The Federal Bureau of Prisons was scheduling a 'Psychological Reconstruction' for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, indicating a post-incident review or assessment.
The process involved gathering documents, conducting staff interviews, and required the assistance of an assigned staff member, often from the SIS department.
The visiting BOP team (Rob and Thank) planned to stay at the Sheraton Tribeca in New York and required transportation to the institution for a multi-day assessment from Tuesday to Thursday.
